page.title: 13Farming - Spring to Winter
page.content: My father who lives nearby arrives about 7a.m. to help finish the milking, wash out the pipelines and equipment and water hose the floors to clean them of slurry. This frees me to go and feed the calves which have been weaned from their mothers milk at about six weeks old when they can be fed hay and cake. Mary is busy feeding the hens and gathering eggs before preparing breakfast for us all to sit down to at 8a.m. The children are ready to set off for school by 8.30 and after another 15 minutes rest we are ready to start the next jobs which are largely dependent on the season. The milking routine is the same from Spring to Autumn and only differs in Winter in so far as the cows and beef stock are kept in a covered yard area and not on the open pasture. A second milking is done daily at 4.30p.m.
